agenda.description: ** REVISION ** SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Higher Education TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Wednesday, April 17, 2019 PLACE: E1.028 (Hearing Room) CHAIR: Senator Brandon Creighton SB 399 Flores Relating to the intercollegiate athletics fee at Texas A&M University--San Antonio; authorizing a fee. SB 507 Miles Relating to authorizing a wellness and success center fee at the University of Houston-Downtown. SB 847 Hughes Relating to the student recreational facility fee at The University of Texas at Tyler. SB 1198 Miles Relating to the intercollegiate athletics fee at Texas Southern University; authorizing the continued imposition of a fee. SB 1540 Menéndez Relating to the designation of support services liaison officers at public institutions of higher education. SB 1678 West Relating to an intercollegiate athletics fee at the University of North Texas at Dallas. SB 1734 Paxton Relating to the dissolution of a non-profit direct-support organization. SB 1758 Creighton Relating to the application of certain occupation-related postsecondary educational financial aid, program support, and student loan repayment programs. SB 1770 Bettencourt Relating to the establishment of the Texas Competency-Based Education Grant Program for certain students enrolled in competency-based baccalaureate degree programs and to formula funding and dropped and repeated course restrictions for students enrolled in those degree programs at public institutions of higher education. SB 1788 Zaffirini Relating to the payment of costs associated with certain education programs of The University of Texas Health Science Center. SB 2011 Buckingham Relating to a study and report regarding streamlining physician licensing requirements for nurses. SB 2231 Watson Relating to the exemption of tuition and laboratory fees at public institutions of higher education for certain paramedics. SB 2343 Creighton Relating to courses offered jointly by certain public junior colleges and independent school districts. SB 2344 Creighton Relating to the annexation of territory by a junior college district. Those wishing to give public testimony, please limit prepared remarks to 3 minutes. If submitting written testimony, please submit 20 copies, with your name on each copy, to the Committee during the hearing. Bills added after last posting: SB 1788 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions of the schedule **
